description: '''Thomas Randolph Bell''' (January 26, 1943 â€“ December 22, 2022) was an American record producer, arranger, and songwriter known as one of the creators of [[Philadelphia soul]] in the 1970s. Hailed as one of the most prolific R&B songwriters and producers ever, Bell found success crafting songs for [[The Delfonics|Delfonics]], [[The Stylistics|Stylistics]], and [[The Spinners (American R&B group)|Spinners]]. In [[Inductees of the Songwriters Hall of Fame|June 2006]], Bell was inducted into the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame]]. In 2016, Bell was inducted into the [[Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum]]. In 2025, Bell was selected for induction into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] in the Musical Excellence Award category.
